vc.prottype: FWLIBAPI short WINAPI pmc_rdpmcrng(unsigned short FlibHndl, short adr_type, short data_type, unsigned short s_number, unsigned short e_number, unsigned short length, IODBPMC *buf);

cmn.p:
Reads the PMC data of the specified PMC address/range.
This function is used to exchange the data between the application on MMC function and LADDER software on PMC.

content.p: Specify the library handle. See "Library handle" for details.
Specify the identification code corresponding to the kind of the PMC address.

ul.li: The referenceable range of PMC data of Series 15
ul.p: It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017"..."K0019" and "K0900"..."K0909" must not be written.
ul.li: The referenceable range of PMC data of Series 15i
ul.p: It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0900"..."K0909" must not be written.
ul.li: The referenceable range of PMC data of Series 16/18 Model B/C
ul.p: It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017"..."K0019" and "K0900"... must not be written.
ul.li: The referenceable range of PMC data of Series 21 Model B, Series 0i-A
ul.p: It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017"..."K0019" must not be written.
ul.li: The referenceable range of PMC data of Series 16i/18i,0i-B(SB7)

tr.td: It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017"..."K0019" and "K0900"... must not be written.

ul.li: The referenceable range of PMC data of Series 21i, 0i-B(SA1)
ul.p: It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017"..."K0019" must not be written.

tr.td: G (Output signal from PMC to CNC)
F (Input signal to PMC from CNC)
Y (Output signal from PMC to machine)
X (Input signal to PMC from machine)
This area is reserved for PMC management software. Do not use it in user programs.
This area is reserved for PMC management software. No I/O can be allocated in this area. Do not use it in user programs.
This area is used to specify the precision of a variable timer.
It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017"..."K0019" must not be written.
G (Output signal from PMC to CNC)
F (Input signal to PMC from CNC)
Y (Output signal to PMC from machine)
X (Input signal from PMC to machine)
M (Input signal from other PMC path)
N (Output signal to other PMC path)
This area is reserved for PMC management software. Do not use it in user programs.
This area is used to specify the precision of a variable timer.
This area is common memory for the multi-PMC function. It is possible for each program to read the same value from, and write to, the area.
No extra relay is available for the dual-check safety PMC.
It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017"..."K0019" must not be written.

ul.li: The referenceable range of Series 0i-F, 30i/31i/32i/35i-B, PMi-A

tr.td: G (Output signal from PMC to CNC)
F (Input signal to PMC from CNC)
Y (Output signal from PMC to machine)
X (Input signal to PMC from machine)
M (Input signal from other PMC path)
N (Output signal to other PMC path)
This area is reserved for PMC management software. Do not use it in user programs.
This area is used to specify the precision of a variable timer.
This area is common memory for the multi-PMC function. It is possible for each program to read the same value from, and write to, the area.
No extra relay is available for the dual-check safety PMC.
To save all area of the data table, the "Nonvolatile PMC data table area expansion (40KB)" option may be necessary.
It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017"..."K0019" must not be written.

ul.li: The referenceable range of PMC data of Power Mate i

tr.td: It is not possible to write to all areas of address 'F' and 'X', and "R9000",... Moreover, "K0017",..,"K0019" and "K0900"..."K0909" must not be written.
See the "PROGRAMMING MANUAL" of PMC about the CNC at which the PMC can be supported.

item.name: data_type
item.content:
Specify the type of the PMC data.
It must be the same one as the type of data of the PMC side.
0:Byte type
1:Word type
2:Long type
4:32-bit floating-point type(30i-B Series/0i-F/PMi-A only)
5:64-bit floating-point type(30i-B Series/0i-F/PMi-A only)

item.name: s_number
item.content: Specify the start PMC address number.

item.name: e_number
item.content: Specify the end PMC address number.

item.name: length
item.content:
Specify the data block length.
data_type is 0(byte type) : length = 8 + N
data_type is 1(word type) : length = 8 + N × 2
data_type is 2(long type) : length = 8 + N × 4
data_type is 4(32-bit floating-point type) : length = 8 + N × 4
data_type is 5(64-bit floating-point type) : length = 8 + N × 8
* N is the number of read data.

content.p:
Pointer to the IODBPMC structure.
The IODBPMC structure is as follows. In case of using PMC memory D in Series 0i-F, 30i/31i/32i/35i-B, PMi-A, define character constant "PMCMEMD" at compiling by the '-D' option.

ol.li: D0100(It is assumed the word type) is read.

tr.td: The content of D0100 is stored.

ol.li: R0200,..,R0209(It is assumed the byte type) is read.

tr.td: The contents of R0200,..,R0209 are stored.

ol.li: D0100(It is assumed the 32-bit floating-point type) is read.

tr.td: The contents of D0100 is stored.

ol.li: R0104, R0112(It is assumed the 64-bit floating-point type) is read.

tr.td: The contents of R0104, R0112 are stored.

content.p: Specify the library handle. See "Library handle" for details.
Specify the identification code corresponding to the kind of the PMC address.

tr.td: M (Signal input from other PMC path)
N (Signal output to other PMC path)
This area is reserved for PMC management software. No I/O can be allocated in this area. Do not use it in user programs.
This area is used to specify the precision of a variable timer. Do not use it in user programs.
This area is common memory for the multi-PMC function. It is possible for each program to read the same value from, and write to, the area.
No extra relay is available for the dual-check safety PMC.

item.name: data_type
item.content:
Specify the type of the PMC data.
It must be the same one as the type of data of the PMC side.
0:Byte type
1:Word type
2:Long type

item.name: s_number
item.content: Specify the start PMC address number.

item.name: e_number
item.content: Specify the end PMC address number.

item.name: length
item.content:
Specify the data block length.
data_type is 0(byte type) : length = 8 + N
data_type is 1(word type) : length = 8 + N × 2
data_type is 2(long type) : length = 8 + N × 4
* N is the number of read data.

content.p:
Pointer to the IODBPMC structure.
The IODBPMC structure is as follows.
In case of using PMC memory D in Series 30i/31i/32i/35i-B, PMi-A, define character constant "PMCMEMD" at compiling by the '-D' option.

ol.li: D0100(It is assumed the word type) is read.

tr.td: The content of D0100 is stored.

ol.li: R0200,..,R0209(It is assumed the byte type) is read.

tr.td: The contents of R0200,..,R0209 are stored.

item.name: EW_LENGTH
item.content:
Data block length error
Size of IODBPMC structure(length) is wrong.

item.name: EW_RANGE
item.content:
Address range error
PMC address number(s_number,e_number) is wrong.

item.name: EW_ATTRIB
item.content:
Data attribute error
Kind of PMC address(adr_type) or type of PMC data (data_type) is wrong.

item.name: EW_PASSWD
item.content:
The data of specified range cannot be read because the data is protected.
(Series 16i/18i/21i, 0i-A/B/C)

option.hssb: The extended driver/library function is necessary.

ethr.p: The Ethernet function and the extended driver/library function are necessary.
However, in case of Series 16i/18i/21i-B, 0i-B/C/D/F, Series 30i and PMi-A, the required CNC option is as follows.

p.ul: above two optional functions are not required.
